page.title: 04THE MAYOR OF ELLESMERE PORT
page.content: This year, the{Mayor}is Mr.Evans,who lives in{Church Lane,}Great Sutton. He told us that all the farmland in the area once belonged to the Church. Services were held in Church Farm until the Church was built. He showed us how{times have changed;}for example an old lady who lived in Great Sutton evicted the occupants of eight cottages opposite her house. She then demolished six of the cottages merely because they spoiled her view. Could this happen today? The{roads have improved}since the Council took over their maintenance. The Mayor remembers cars getting stuck in the potholes outside his house. He feels that houses should be built, allowing more room for extensions. He was worried that{public footpaths } (a relic of former rural times) may be lost through lack of use.
